title: Kolkata shocker: Victim alleges rape was videotaped; what initial probe revealed
content: Kolkata Police reported the arrest of Manujit Mishra, a former Trinamool Congress Chhatra Parishad leader, for allegedly raping a law student within college premises. Mishra, also a temporary staff member and lawyer, is accused of filming the assault and threatening to release it.

title: ‘Difficult country to trade’: Trump slams Canada over digital tax, halts talks
content: Donald Trump halted trade talks with Canada. This action followed Canada's digital services tax on American tech firms. Trump called it an attack and cited unfair tariffs on US agricultural exports. He accused Canada of copying the European Union's tax policies. The US will soon impose tariffs on Canadian goods. Experts fear a wider economic dispute due to this halt.

title: Born to fly: Shubhanshu Shukla was always a natural in sky; now he’s a star in orbit
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, the first Indian to board the ISS, displayed exceptional flying talent early in his career at the National Defence Academy. His instructor, Group Captain (retd) Anupam Banerjee, recognized Shukla's natural aptitude and dedication.

title: 'Without question': Trump says will bomb Iran again if it gets into nukes
content: Following US airstrikes on Iranian nuclear facilities, President Trump warned Iran against resuming its uranium enrichment program, threatening further military action. This came after Ayatollah Khamenei's vow to target US bases if attacked again. Trump asserted the strikes inflicted significant damage, while Khamenei downplayed their effectiveness, accusing the US of protecting Israel.

title: America’s China threat: Huawei’s new laptop fuels debate on US sanctions
content: Huawei's new MateBook Fold uses a SMIC-made 7nm chip, showcasing China's tech self-reliance amid U.S. sanctions. Despite this, China lags behind TSMC's advanced chip technology. U.S. restrictions hinder China's access to cutting-edge chipmaking tools and AI chips, intensifying competition in the tech sector. China is pinning its hopes on Huawei and SMIC for advanced chipmaking.

title: Political outcry over RSS' call to review 'secular' and 'socialist in Preamble
content: Opposition parties have strongly criticized RSS general secretary Dattatreya Hosabale's suggestion to review the words 'socialist' and 'secular' in the Constitution's Preamble, labeling it an attack on the Constitution's core values. Congress leader Rahul Gandhi accused the RSS-BJP of wanting to replace the Constitution with 'Manusmriti'.

title: ‘Operation Narnia’ and 'Red Wedding': How Israel pulled off 'Game of Thrones' on Iran
content: Israel executed strikes against Iran. The operation targeted military leaders and nuclear scientists. It is called 'Red Wedding' and 'Operation Narnia'. US support amplified the effect. Iran's nuclear infrastructure is damaged. Revolutionary Guard leadership is decimated. Israel exposed Iran's weak defenses. A ceasefire is in place. Future talks are uncertain. Iran may accelerate nuclear weaponization. The situation remains tense.

title: Shefali Jariwala no more: Bigg Boss 13 star dies of cardiac arrest; actress was 42
content: In a devastating turn of events, actress Shefali Jariwala, recognized for her participation in Bigg Boss 13, has tragically died at the age of 42. She reportedly suffered a cardiac arrest on June 27th, as confirmed by a hospital receptionist.

title: Passport Seva 2.0: E-Passports to boost travel security; guide to apply online
content: India's passport services have undergone a significant transformation, as acknowledged by External Affairs Minister Dr. S. Jaishankar on Passport Seva Divas. The Passport Seva Programme (PSP) streamlines application processes, extending facilities to Tier 2 and 3 cities through Post Office Passport Seva Kendras. The introduction of e-Passports, embedded with secure microchips, enhances security and expedites border crossings.

title: IND vs ENG: Suryavanshi wears no. 18 jersey, sparks Kohli comparisons; photo goes viral
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old, has ignited excitement in Indian cricket with a stunning 48 off 19 balls in his U19 debut against England. Donning the iconic No. 18 jersey, famously worn by Virat Kohli, Suryavanshi's fearless batting and explosive strokeplay have drawn comparisons and fueled hopes for a promising future. His innings powered India U19 to a six-wicket victory.

title: ‘It will hurt them’: Why Putin plans to cut defense budget while West arms up?
content: Amidst rising NATO defense budgets and warnings of a potential Russian attack, President Putin announced a reduction in Russia's military spending, currently at 6.3% of GDP, citing inflation concerns. He dismissed NATO's buildup as non-threatening while acknowledging stalled peace talks with Ukraine due to conflicting proposals.

title: IND vs ENG: Cues from Birmingham nets - Uncertainty over Bumrah, Arshdeep vs Gill
content: After their heartbreaking five-wicket loss in Leeds, the Shubman Gill-led Indian team hit the nets ahead of the second Test of the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, starting on July 2 at Edgbaston. TimesofIndia.com brings you all the talking points from India’s first net session in Birmingham.

title: US government warns: Green Cards and Visas at risk; will be revoked if ...
content: USCIS has issued a stern warning, stating that immigrants risk losing their green cards and visas if they break the law. The agency emphasized that advocating violence, supporting terrorism, or encouraging such activities will result in ineligibility to remain in the U.S.

title: Leafs trade buzz: Andersson in Toronto’s sights; Flames may deal veteran D-man
content: Toronto Maple Leafs are eyeing defensive reinforcements. Rasmus Andersson from Calgary Flames emerges as a potential trade target. Leafs aim to bolster their blue line with Andersson's skills. His addition could provide stability and toughness. Calgary might trade Andersson due to team's rebuilding phase. This move could benefit both teams.

title: 'Verify, fact-check, don't believe ...': Sunil Gavaskar slams fake quotes - Watch
content: Sunil Gavaskar has voiced his concern over the proliferation of fake quotes attributed to him on sports websites and social media. He urged fans to verify information and not blindly believe everything they read online, especially from unverified sources. Gavaskar, currently commentating on the India-England Test series, highlighted the issue after fabricated remarks circulated following India's loss at Headingley.

title: Exclusive: Gukesh vs Carlsen not happening in Vegas; why is world champion not playing?
content: World Champion D Gukesh will not be playing in the Las Vegas leg of the Freestyle Chess Grand Slam, citing exhaustion after Norway Chess. Vidit Gujrathi will replace him, donning Gukesh’s red jacket. The $750,000 event runs July 16–20 at Wynn Las Vegas. Meanwhile, the India leg in September is cancelled, and Jan Henric Buettner will step down as CEO on July 1.

title: 'Not on students' union list': TMC distances itself from Kolkata gangrape prime accused
content: The Trinamool Congress (TMC) has distanced itself from Manujit Mishra, the prime accused in a college gangrape case, amidst accusations from the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) of his affiliation with the party. The TMC denies any link to the incident, emphasizing that justice should be based on the crime, not political affiliation.

title: US Supreme Court curbs judge power; Trump says 'radical Left tried to overrule President'
content: In a 6-3 decision, the Supreme Court limited federal judges' ability to issue nationwide injunctions, a victory for President Trump who criticized lower courts for blocking his policies. The case involved Trump's attempt to revoke birthright citizenship, though the court didn't rule on its constitutionality.

title: Chennai: Rail fracture near Arakkonam disrupts train services
content: Images from the site show the third coach of the nine-coach MEMU rake partially tilted after passing over a broken portion of the track.

title: IND vs ENG: Five sixes! Vaibhav Suryavanshi's whirlwind knock lights up U19 ODI
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old Indian prodigy, showcased his talent with a rapid 48 off 19 balls in his debut Youth ODI against England U19. His explosive innings, featuring five sixes, propelled India's chase of 175. Earlier, England U19 were bowled out for 174, with Rocky Flintoff scoring 56, as Indian bowlers, led by Kanishk Chouhan (3/20), dominated.

title: 'Charade at Pak’s behest': India calls arbitration court under Indus treaty 'illegal'
content: India has rejected the Court of Arbitration under the Indus Waters Treaty as illegal, refusing to recognize its authority to hear cases related to the Kishenganga and Ratle hydropower projects. The government emphasized that the court's formation violated the 1960 treaty, deeming its proceedings and decisions void. Furthermore, India has placed the treaty in abeyance until Pakistan ceases cross-border terrorism.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Gamble worth taking, but …' - Ex-England captain on Archer’s Test return
content: Nasser Hussain supports Jofra Archer's return to England's Test squad as a worthwhile risk, but advises against immediately including him in the second Test against India at Edgbaston. Archer, who last played a Test in February 2021, has battled injuries. Hussain acknowledges Archer's comeback journey and physical challenges.

title: 'What kind of country are we becoming': Man caught stealing life jacket in IndiGo flight
content: A video circulating on social media captures a passenger on an IndiGo flight attempting to steal a life jacket. A fellow passenger confronted him, leading to the discovery of the stolen item in his backpack. This incident has sparked outrage online, with many users expressing disbelief and calling for strict action against the individual, especially amidst recent air travel concerns.

title: Rs 1.58 crore worth whale vomit (ambergris) seized near Vadodara; six arrested
content: Vadodara police apprehended six individuals attempting to sell ambergris, a rare and valuable substance, in the city. The seized ambergris is estimated to be worth over Rs 1.58 crore. Authorities intercepted the accused in Bil village, discovering the ambergris during a car search.

title: ‘A new chapter begins …’: India pacer blessed with baby boy; wishes pour in
content: Indian fast bowler Mukesh Kumar and his wife, Divya Singh, are celebrating the arrival of their newborn son. The couple, who married in November 2023, shared the joyous news on social media, marking a new chapter in their lives. Mukesh, known for his dedication to cricket, is expected to return to the field soon, bringing renewed motivation after embracing fatherhood.

title: NHL trade rumor: Canadiens, Blues eye $12M D-man in Islanders deal
content: In a developing NHL trade rumor, reports suggest the Montreal Canadiens and St. Louis Blues are both in talks with the New York Islanders over acquiring their $12,000,000 defenseman. Insider updates have sparked speculation about major roster shifts as the teams explore high-stakes moves this offseason.

title: Tied up, locked, many without clothes: 42 elderly rescued from Noida old-age home
content: In Noida, Uttar Pradesh, authorities rescued 42 elderly residents from an illegal old-age home. Disturbing conditions were uncovered, including women tied up and others locked in basement-like rooms. The facility, Anand Niketan Vridha Seva Ashram, lacked government authorization, prompting an investigation and relocation of the rescued individuals to government-approved facilities.

title: Photo: Beckham recovers after surgery; wife Victoria shares hospital snap
content: David Beckham is recovering in hospital following surgery to address a wrist injury that has troubled him since 2003. Victoria Beckham shared updates on Instagram, showing David in good spirits post-surgery and displaying a 'Get well soon' bracelet from one of their children. This news comes shortly after the announcement of Beckham's upcoming knighthood.

title: Historic! Praggnanandhaa clinches UzChess Cup Masters title, becomes India no.1
content: Rameshbabu Praggnanandhaa has ascended to India's No. 1 chess player, securing the UzChess Cup Masters title by defeating Nodirbek Abdusattorov. This victory propelled his live rating to 2778.3, ranking him World No. 4 and surpassing World Chess Champion D Gukesh in live classical ratings. This triumph signifies a generational shift in Indian chess, marking Praggnanandhaa's arrival as the nation's new chess leader.

title: Tony Gonzalez and Nikko spotted in Venice for Lauren Sanchez and Jeff Bezos’ wedding
content: Lauren Sanchez's son, Nikko, and his father, Tony Gonzalez, were seen in Venice, attending Sanchez's wedding to Jeff Bezos. Nikko was accompanied by his girlfriend, Ginebra Ferreira. Sanchez highlighted her successful co-parenting relationship with Gonzalez and his wife, October, emphasizing their close friendship and the positive impact it has on Nikko.

title: Kashmiri doctor denied admission at Coimbatore hospital for refusing to shave beard
content: The Jammu and Kashmir Students Association has requested Tamil Nadu's Chief Minister M.K. Stalin to intervene in a case at Kovai Medical Centre and Hospital (KMCH) in Coimbatore. A doctor from Kashmir, Dr. Zubair Ahmad, was allegedly denied admission for refusing to shave his beard, citing religious obligations.

title: 'Mask has come off': Rahul flays RSS over call to drop 'secular' from Constitution
content: Rahul Gandhi has intensified his criticism of the RSS following Dattatreya Hosabale's call to remove "socialist and secular" from the Constitution's Preamble. Gandhi argues that the RSS opposes the Constitution's emphasis on equality, secularism, and justice, accusing them of seeking to replace it with Manusmriti to disenfranchise the poor.

title: 'You'll be 90 metres away': Neeraj Chopra surprises fan with paid trip to NC Classic; post goes viral
content: Neeraj Chopra, the Olympic medallist, has delighted a fan by offering an all-expenses-paid trip to the inaugural Neeraj Chopra Classic in Bengaluru after the fan requested financial assistance on social media. This generous act underscores the importance of the NC Classic, India's first World Athletics Category 'A' Javelin competition, featuring top international athletes.

title: 'What can be done if ... ': TMC leader's controversial remark on Kolkata rape case
content: Kalyan Banerjee, a Trinamool Congress leader, made a controversial statement regarding the Kolkata law college rape case. He questioned the possibility of preventing such incidents between friends. A student was allegedly raped within the college premises on June 25. Police arrested three men, including a former student leader Manojit Mishra. Mishra has connections with senior Trinamool Congress leaders.

title: IND v ENG: After Leeds heroics, Pant on the brink of joining cricket's elite
content: Rishabh Pant stands on the verge of joining cricket legends like Don Bradman and Rahul Dravid. As Team India prepares for the Edgbaston Test, Pant aims to achieve a rare feat: scoring centuries in three consecutive Tests in England. His previous Edgbaston innings of 146 in 2022 showcased his brilliance.

title: 'Brightest blast I've ever seen': Fighter pilot recalls Iran strike by B-2 bombers
content: In June 2025, the US military executed 'Operation Midnight Hammer,' a strike on Iran's Fordo nuclear site, culminating years of meticulous planning and weapon development. The mission, authorized by President Trump, involved B-2 crews deploying GBU-57 bunker-busters to target the facility's vent shafts. While the US asserts 'total obliteration,' Iran disputes the impact, though the IAEA confirmed extensive damage.

title: 'That’s why I married your dad': Cooper Flagg’s mom Kelly cracks marriage joke
content: Cooper Flagg was drafted No. 1 overall by the Dallas Mavericks. His mother, Kelly Flagg, joked about marrying his tall father for basketball genes. A video of the exchange went viral. Kelly, a former college player, emphasized her son's love for the game. She and Ralph Flagg encouraged Cooper to stay true to himself.

title: Live sex shows on terrace: Hyderabad couple charged viewers Rs 500-Rs 2,000
content: In Hyderabad, a couple from Amberpet was apprehended for allegedly live-streaming a sex act from their home's terrace, charging viewers via a social media app. Authorities raided their residence following an alert, discovering the couple in a semi-nude state, ready to broadcast. They confessed to streaming to alleviate financial struggles, with police seizing phones, tripods, and payment records.

title: 'Acted as mother': Latur traffic constable goes viral after slapping girls
content: A female traffic constable in Latur faced backlash after a video surfaced showing her slapping and verbally abusing three young women for riding triple-seat on a two-wheeler. Constable Pranita Musne admitted to the assault, justifying her actions as concern for road safety after witnessing them driving rashly. She has apologized for her language but stands by her intention.

title: 'Felt drowsy': Engineer arrested for LLB student’s hit-and-run death in Gurgaon
content: In Gurgaon, a civil engineer named Mohit was arrested after a fatal accident on the Delhi-Jaipur highway. His car struck and killed Harsh Singhal, a law student, and critically injured Abhishek Kumar. Mohit claimed drowsiness led to the incident near Hero Honda Chowk. Bystanders tried to chase the car, but Mohit fled.

title: How Pakistani 'Priya Sharma' lured Navy clerk to leak Op Sindoor secrets
content: Intelligence agencies arrested Vishal Yadav, a Naval Headquarters UDC, for allegedly spying for Pakistan, receiving payments through bank transfers and cryptocurrency. His activities surfaced during a review of Facebook accounts flagged in a 2022 espionage case. Yadav shared sensitive military information, including updates on military operations, and received payments ranging from Rs 5,000 to Rs 50,000.

title: 'I think it's important': Why India didn't sign SCO joint release? EAM gives 'context'
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar supported Defence Minister Rajnath Singh's decision to abstain from signing a joint statement at the SCO Defence Ministers' meeting in China. Jaishankar emphasized that the SCO's primary objective is to combat terrorism. However, one member nation blocked any reference to terrorism in the outcome document.

title: MPs across party lines in parliamentary panel support forward-looking policy for Bangladesh
content: All MPs displayed understanding of the issues between India and Bangladesh and there was a real desire among the MPs to mend the bilateral ties and take things forward, say sources

title: Palaniswami to begin tour of Tamil Nadu on July 7 as part of poll campaign
content: Between July 7 and 21, he will visit Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam, Thanjavur, Tiruvarur, and Villupuram districts

title: TNCC president calling on Ramadoss fuels speculation of PMK allying with DMK-front
content: Mr. Selvaperunthagai clarifies that it was a courtesy call and claims that he decided to visit Thailapuram as he happened to pass by that route. Sources close to Dr. Ramadoss also swore there was no conversation about politics during the meeting.

title: Vaiko condemns RSS general secretary’s call for removal ‘secular’, ‘socialist’ from Preamble
content: He calls for democratic and progressive forces across the country to come together and oppose the Hindutva forces’ attempts to subvert the Constitution

title: RSS never accepted Ambedkar’s Constitution, says Opposition after RSS leader’s comment on secularism, socialism
content: Rahul Gandhi says the ‘mask’ of the RSS has come off again; CPI (M) says the RSS exposes its long-standing objective of ‘subverting’ the Constitution

title: Digha Rath Yatra kicks off with political war over chariots between TMC and BJP
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee inaugurated the first ‘Rath Yatra’ from the newly constructed Jagannath temple in the coastal town of Digha. LoP Suvendu Adhikari participated in Rath Yatra in three different places in the State

title: Centre announces Adi Karmyogi programme for nationwide capacity building in tribal scheme implementation
content: Officials deliberate and conclude that the real challenge is a lack of motivation in officials and not a lack of schemes or programmes

title: Death of R&AW officer in Dhaka in 1974 linked to Mujib assassination plot, claims book
content: Manash Ghosh’s Mujib’s Blunders suggests Phanindra Nath Banerjee’s death preceded and possibly foreshadowed the 1975 coup

title: Thackeray cousins to jointly oppose mandatory Hindi in schools
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) and MNS to hold rally on July 5 in Mumbai; Sharad Pawar also voices concern over the three-language policy

title: First batch of pilgrims visit Mansarovar, appeal for more yatra slots to be opened
content: First batch included only 36 pilgrims despite maximum strength of 50 due to withdrawals for health reasons; pilgrims have visited Mount Kailash and Mansarovar Lake and will cross back into India on July 1

title: Govt. unlikely to implement 20°C to 28°C AC temp range immediately: Union Environment Minister
content: I do not think it will happen immediately; capacities will be gradually built for it over time, says Union Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav

title: Special court grants NIA 10-day remand of two Pahalgam terror accused
content: The NIA produced the duo before the special NIA court, which granted a further 10-day remand, they said.

title: Devotees throng Puri as Rath Yatra begins; 600 hospitalised due to ‘extreme’ heat
content: Several layers of security were put in place in Puri in order to ensure that one of the biggest religious congregations in India passes without any untoward incident

title: Actor shares ‘goosebumps-evoking’ heroics of an all-women flight crew
content: Actor Antony Varghese’s Instagram post on his experience of flying from Hyderabad to Kochi in an all-women crew Indigo flight, which eventually landed at the Kochi airport after two aborted landing attempts due to bad weather, goes viral

title: Congress attack on Hosabale comments are a diversionary tactic: BJP
content: The RSS general secretary had called for a review of the terms ‘secular’, ‘socialist’, added to the Constitution during the Emergency; BJP spokesperson says it is Congress that violated Constitution, calls for apology

title: Karnataka Police recommend unified national platform for efficient cybercrime probes
content: This platform would also enable regulators to monitor bank compliance and response times to law enforcement agency requests, says report

title: Protests erupt across Kolkata over gang rape of law student; Opposition flays Mamata government
content: West Bengal Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari shares pictures of Mishra with Trinamool national general secretary Abhishek Banerjee and other leaders; political parties blame the Mamata Banerjee-led Trinamool Congress government for the incident; protests erupt across State

title: Diesel mixed with water stalls 19 official vehicles ahead of CM Mohan Yadav’s visit
content: Fuel pump in Ratlam sealed; District Collector confirms presence of water content, FIR lodged against management

title: Congress urges Centre to find out the status of Indians stranded in Russia
content: Urging the government to strongly take up their case with Russia, Punjab Congress president Amarinder Singh Raja Warring says 126 Indian citizens from Punjab, Uttar Pradesh, Jammu-Kashmir and Maharashtra were trafficked into the Russian Army to fight war. At least 14 remain missing, he says

title: Yoga ‘guru’ arrested in Chhattisgarh for possessing cannabis
content: A native of Dongargarh town, the 45-year-old told the police that he lived in Goa for over 10 years and taught yoga to Indians and foreigners; his passport has been seized by police

title: Competition heats up for TNEA 2025 as more students score high cut-off score
content: Several thousand students are bunched in cut-off ranges at all levels. Students with a cut-off of 198 this year will find themselves ranked similarly to those with 197 last year. But they will now be competing against 1,035 more candidates

title: India ‘categorically rejects’ Court of Arbitration’s ‘supplemental award’ on Kishenganga, Ratle hydropower projects
content: “India’s position has all along been that the constitution of this so-called arbitral body is in itself a serious breach of Indus Waters Treaty,” says MEA

title: Supreme Court to examine if verdict requiring probe agency to give accused written grounds of arrest will apply retrospectively
content: Bench issues notice on a petition filed by Karnataka, which had sought a clarification if the judgment in the case of Pankaj Bansal versus Union of India would have retrospective effect

title: Assam to toughen Aadhaar issuance rules in a bid to curb illegal immigration from Bangladesh
content: Worried by frequent cross-border movements, the Mizoram government plans to confiscate identity cards of Myanmar nationals

title: INDIA bloc leaders in Bihar slam ECI over revision list, calls it a mockery of democracy and Constitution
content: Left leaders allege that such activities are being carried out with the intention of committing electoral fraud at the behest of Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: Toll rates hiked on Bengaluru’s Electronics City flyover, Attibele highway effective July 1
content: The hike, applicable till June 30, 2026, is based on the Wholesale Price Index as on March 31, 2025, according to a public notice by BETPL

title: Licence of food units with fake health cards to be suspended
content: Health department asks officials to hold Statewide checks to confirm authenticity of health cards issued to food handlers

title: Special Intensive Revision of Bihar electoral rolls akin to NRC: CPI(M) to Election Commission
content: There are fears that it may be used to target a certain section of voters leading to their disenfranchisement, says Polit Bureau member Nilotpal Basu

title: Himachal flash floods: Search and rescue operation resumes
content: Five bodies have been recovered from a hydro project site in the Kangra district that was hit by flash floods on Wednesday; search underway for six missing people

title: HC sets aside 3.70 acres land allotment to IAMC at Raidurg
content: Free allotment of land cannot be justified unless the purpose of allotment is greater and such allotment is to an institution or person who earns no profit, the Bench said

title: Naidu unveils vision to make A.P. a global tourism destination
content: Tourism is the engine of future growth and key to achieving economic transformation, employment generation, and cultural promotion, says CM at a conclave where 82 MoUs worth ₹10,329 crore were signed to promote the sector

title: CPI(M) rejects the inference that Nilambur’s win widened UDF’s path to victory in 2026 Assembly polls
content: CPI(M) State secretary M.V. Govindan says the party had shored up its base in Nilambur despite the UDF harnessing radical Islamist and Hindu majoritarian forces to its electoral bandwagon

title: Class VIII student allegedly stabs senior to death in Maharashtra school
content: Altercation during school break in Ahilyanagar turns fatal; police suspect family dispute as possible trigger

title: Rights of Indian fishermen given away during Emergency, says Jaishankar alluding to 1976 Katchatheevu pact
content: The External Affairs Minister recollected his personal experience from that era and said Emergency proved that democracy and freedom are in the “blood” of Indian people

title: Vande Bharat encounters ‘hot axle’ problem near Harihar, passengers sent by other trains
content: The Dharwad-Bengaluru service was short terminated and all passengers deboarded at the Davangere Railway Station

title: CPI(M) launches protest against smart electricity meters and rising power tariff in Vijayawada
content: The party leader calls upon people to join a protest rally on July 4 in front of the CPDCL office in Vijayawada

title: Aluva Cyber police foil ‘virtual arrest’ attempt
content: A fraudster allegedly threatened the victim, claiming that he had been booked for illicit trade, including drug smuggling, carried out through a website launched using his Aadhaar card

title: Rumblings in Congress: Is it political posturing by Siddaramaiah’s loyalists to bargain with party high command?
content: By issuing statements often, Siddaramaiah’s loyalists appear to be putting a lot of pressure on the party leadership to allow his continuation in the post for the full five-year term

title: Zumba in Kerala’s schools draws fire from Muslim groups; government stands firm on anti-drug push
content: The programme, integrated by the General Education department into school schedule this academic year, aims to reduce stress among students and provide them with a healthy outlet to combat the rising threat of drug abuse

title: Cyber police nabs two for alleged digital arrest of woman, son
content: A woman and her son from Kozhikode had lost ₹18 lakh in the alleged fraud that took place in February 2025

title: A.P. Police will make extensive use of AI for crime detection, prevention, says Naidu
content: Hailing a hackathon organised by the police, Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu says the best technology based on the use cases from the event will be adopted to complement the existing resources of the department

title: Modern technology and enhanced surveillance across national highways for curtailing road safety violations
content: NHAI aims to roll out ATMS across 30,000 kilometres of National Highways over the next 2-3 years; a 56 km stretch as the latest ATMS launched since a new 2023 policy that enables issuing of challans through the system

title: Cabinet calls Governor’s attention to protocol governing official functions at Raj Bhavan
content: Cabinet cites discussions in the Constituent Assembly regarding the sole use of constitutionally sanctioned national emblems, including the national flag and national anthem, as well as the avoidance of other symbols with political, religious, regional, or linguistic overtones at State events

title: Now, Nellore city roads will be cleaned only by sweeping machine vehicles, says Minister
content: 28 sweeping machine vehicles have been brought to the city through Swachh Andhra Corporation, says Minister for MA&UD while adding that manual sweeping of the main roads will be stopped

title: Officials to provide free Retail Sales Associate training for youth in Eluru district
content: Candidates who complete the course will be provided job placement opportunities in various private sector companies, says District Employment Officer

title: Wetzel: Please don't expand NCAA basketball tournaments
content: The NCAA will risk an iconic slice of Americana if it expands the NCAA men's and women's tournaments again.

title: 49ers CB Lenoir arrested on obstruction charge
content: 49ers cornerback Deommodore Lenoir was arrested in Los Angeles on Thursday night on a charge of obstruction of justice, police said.

title: Source: Isles' Dobson to Habs for 1st-round picks
content: The Islanders have traded defenseman Noah Dobson to the Canadiens for a return that includes a pair of first-round picks -- a potential huge impact on the NHL draft.

title: Fever's Clark to miss marquee Bueckers meeting
content: Caitlin Clark's groin injury will keep her out of a first WNBA matchup with fellow No. 1 pick Paige Bueckers.

title: Knapp's 11-under 61 sets Rocket Classic record
content: Jake Knapp shot an 11-under 61 to break a Rocket Classic record that stood for less than a day, becoming the first PGA Tour player to break 60 and shoot a 61 or lower in the same season.

title: Mariners' Raleigh joins Derby, plans family event
content: Mariners catcher Cal Raleigh, who leads the majors in homers with 32, says he will participate in the Home Run Derby with his father pitching and his younger brother hopefully behind the plate.

title: Sources: 76ers' Drummond picks up $5M option
content: Sixers center Andre Drummond, who received extra playing time in place of an injured Joel Embiid, has picked up his $5 million player option for the 2025-26 season, sources told ESPN.

title: Autographed Jordan rookie card sells for $2.5M
content: An autographed 1986-87 Fleer Michael Jordan rookie card has sold at Joopiter -- 13-time Grammy winning artist and producer Pharrell Williams' auction house -- for $2.5 million, including a 25% buyer's premium.

title: Early 2026 NBA mock draft: Meet the four contenders for the No. 1 pick
content: There's considerable excitement around next year's draft class thanks to four players vying for the top spot.

title: The NFL's most team- and player-friendly contracts at six positions: Who makes the list?
content: We picked out deals that favor the team's salary cap (Sam Darnold) and deals that favor the player's bank account (Jaycee Horn) at key positions.

title: Final 2025 NHL mock draft: Predictions for the top 32 picks
content: While the top two picks appear to be locked in, what happens after that? Here's the final projection before Friday's first round.

title: NHL draft buzz: Sharks not set at No. 2?
content: The first round is Friday. Our reporters pass along the latest intel they're hearing from around the league.

title: Best power half-seasons ever: Where Cal Raleigh and Aaron Judge rank -- and whether they can keep it up
content: Two AL hitters are crushing long balls at a historic rate. Before their 81st games, we compare their first-half performances to the best ever -- and whether they can keep it going.

title: Power Rankings: A new No. 1 and a top-5 debut
content: The Mets falling as their slump continues and the Astros notching their highest ranking of the season.

title: State check: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 1 quiz
content: How well do you know your state sports trivia? From D.C. to Alabama, we're putting your knowledge to the test.

title: A weird, wonderful night with Ryans, the Rockies and an unlikely world-record attempt

title: Real Madrid advance, set up Juventus CWC clash

title: Athletic press LaLiga on Barça signing Williams
content: Athletic Club have confirmed they met with LaLiga to question Barcelona's ability to sign players within the league's financial fair play rules amid the Catalan side's ongoing pursuit of Nico Williams.

title: Hayes on Lavelle's stellar return: 'Only one Rose'
content: Rose Lavelle scored a goal and added an assist in her first international minutes in nearly seven months Thursday as the United States beat Ireland 4-0 at Dick's Sporting Goods Park in Commerce City, Colorado.

title: Pep: 'Long time' since Man City played this well
content: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola said his players got the chance to remember "what it was like to be a good team" as they thrashed Juventus 5-2.

title: Mexico's Chávez out of Gold Cup after tearing ACL
content: Mexico midfielder Luis Chavez tore his right anterior cruciate ligament while training ahead of the Gold Cup quarterfinal match against Saudi Arabia and will now depart camp to receive medical treatment.

title: Liverpool sign Kerkez, spending nears $197M

title: Man Kills Father Over Front Seat Dispute In Tempo: Delhi Cops
content: A 26-year-old man allegedly shot dead his father in north Delhi's Timarpur area after being denied the front seat in a tempo that the family had hired to shift to their native place in Uttarakhand, police sources said on Friday.

title: Putin Says Russia Plans To Cut Military Spending From Next Year
content: NATO allies on Wednesday agreed to raise their collective spending goal to 5% of gross domestic product in the next 10 years, citing what they called the long-term threat posed by Russia and the need to strengthen civil and military resilience.

title: A Trump Political Dynasty? His Son Eric Says...
content: Donald Trump's second son fueled speculation that his family seeks to establish a multi-generational political dynasty, saying he and other relatives may run for public office.

title: "Saved Him From Ugly, Ignominious Death": Trump On Iran's Khamenei
content: The US president accused the Iranian leader of ingratitude after Khamenei said in a defiant message that reports of damage to its nuclear sites from US bombing were exaggerated, and said Iran had beaten Israel and dealt Washington a "slap."

title: Danish General Says He Is Not Losing Sleep Over US Plans For Greenland
content: The head of Denmark's Arctic command said the prospect of a US takeover of Greenland was not keeping him up at night after talks with a senior US general last week but that more must be done to deter any Russian attack on the Arctic island.

title: India Bans Imports Of Certain Jute, Other Items From Bangladesh Via Land
content: The goods under these curbs include jute products, flax tow and waste, jute and other bast fibres, jute, single flax yarn, single yarn of jute, multiple folded, woven fabrics or flex, and unbleached woven fabrics of jute.

title: July 5 March Against Hindi "Imposition": Sharad Pawar Led NCP Extends Support
content: The Sharad Pawar-led NCP (SP) on Friday said it will support the protest march scheduled for July 5 here against the "imposition" of Hindi in the school curriculum in Maharashtra through the National Education Policy 2020.

title: Trump Claims He Stopped India, Pak War By Threatening To 'Cancel All Deals'
content: Trump again repeated his claim that he stopped the war between India and Pakistan, which he claimed could have turned nuclear, after he told the countries that Washington would not "trade" with Delhi and Islamabad.

title: "Difficult Country": Trump Calls Off Trade Talks With Canada
content: US President Donald Trump said on Friday that he is calling off trade negotiations with Canada immediately, citing its digital services tax and adding that Ottawa will learn of their tariff rate within a week.

title: Our Oceans Are In Trouble: Here's How To Take Action Beyond The Outrage
content: Our oceans are in trouble. Catches from many of the world's fisheries are declining, with some fishing practices destroying enormous areas of the sea bed.

title: "I Think We Are Going To Reach A Deal": Trump On Trade Deal With India
content: Earlier this month, while speaking at the US-India Strategic Partnership Forum, US Secretary of Commerce Howard Lutnick said that a trade deal between India and the United States could be finalised soon.

title: Men From Higher Caste Beat Dalit Family Cultivating Field, Snatch Seeds
content: In an incident that has, once again, raised troubling questions about caste violence and land rights in rural India, a Dalit family has been brutally attacked with sticks while cultivating land they claim belongs to them.

title: Anti-Lock Braking System Mandatory For All 2-Wheelers Manufactured After Jan 2026
content: The transport ministry has made the anti-lock braking system mandatory for all new two-wheelers manufactured after January next year, irrespective of engine capacity, to enhance riders' safety.

title: Wildfire Smoke Can Harm Your Brain, Not Just Your Lungs
content: Wildfires are already burning in parts of Canada, and as they do, many communities are already facing the familiar thick haze as smoke drifts in.

title: Court Grants Anti-Terror Agency NIA 10-Day Remand Of 2 Pahalgam Terror Accused
content: A special court of the National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Friday granted a 10-day remand of the two accused who were arrested for harbouring Pakistani terrorists behind the deadly Pahalgam terror attack in April, officials said.

title: Manipur Celebrates 'Kang' Festival, Thousands Pull Lord Jagannath's Chariot In Rath Yatra
content: The annual 'Kang' festival, Manipur's own version of the Jagannath rath yatra, was celebrated with hundreds of people coming out to see the pulling of the chariot.

title: Delhi Government Extends Existing Excise Policy For Financial Year 2025-26
content: The Delhi government has extended its excise policy for the financial year 2025-26 even as work is underway to come up with a new regime to regulate liquor trade in the national capital.

title: 4,415 Indians Evacuated From Conflict Zones In Iran, Israel Via 19 Flights: Centre
content: The Indian government has initiated Operation Sindhu to evacuate Indian nationals from conflict zones in Iran and Israel amid escalating tensions in West Asia. The operation, which began on June 18, has successfully evacuated over 4415 Indians.

title: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders To Acquire Controlling Stake In Colombo Dockyard PLC
content: State-run Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Limited (MDL) has decided to acquire a controlling stake in Sri Lanka's Colombo Dockyard PLC under a USD 52.96 million deal, a move that is expected to expand India's strategic presence in the island nation.

title: In Big Win For Trump, US Supreme Court Curbs Judges' Powers To Block His Orders
content: The US Supreme Court handed President Donald Trump a major victory by curbing the power of lone federal judges to block executive actions.

title: Australian CEO stabbed to death at house party, 15-year-old boy arrested
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world.
